review: a film that asks the question "if a man helps you to walk your first steps in life, why can't you help him walk his last steps," director ravi chopra's family drama finds a father reaching out to his children with unexpected results. throughout the years raj malhotra has provided his wife pooja and their four sons with all the love and comforts that he could offer. their well being a direct result of his lifelong dedication to his family, his entire world is turned upside down when, following his retirement, none of his children are willing to repay him for his generosity. as raj and pooja begin to rely on the kindness of strangers of sustenance, the couple is faced with the unexpected challenge of overcoming their hardships and forging a loving future and other.
